text: , also called was an old province of Japan in the area of Iwate Prefecture and Aomori Prefecture on the island of Honshū.Nussbaum, Louis-Frédéric. (2005). "Mutsu" in Japan Encyclopedia, p. 676; "Rikuoko" at p. 790. It was also known as Murdoch, James. (1903). A History of Japan, Vol. 3. p. 794. or . The history of this province started in 1868 and ended in 1872. ==History== In the Meiji period, the provinces of Japan were converted into prefectures. Maps of Japan and Mutsu Province were reformed in the 1870s.Nussbaum, "Provinces and prefectures" at p. 780. ==Related pages== * Provinces of Japan * Prefectures of Japan * List of regions of Japan * List of islands of Japan * Sanriku ==References== ==Other websites == * Murdoch's map of provinces, 1903 Category:Former provinces of Japan Category:Aomori Prefecture Category:Iwate Prefecture Category:1870s disestablishments Category:1868 establishments in Japan Category:19th-century disestablishments in Japan
title: Mutsu Province (1868)
